meaningMnemonic:
When there's a <kanji>district</kanji> in a <kanji>region</kanji>, it's called a <vocabulary>zone</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>district</vocabulary>.

区域 is a formal word for a kind of designated <vocabulary>area</vocabulary>, usually one defined by specific boundaries or characteristics. It's often used in urban planning, like for no-parking zones or residential areas. It can also apply to regions like postal districts, police jurisdictions, or restricted areas.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
